THAT Lab

I am a Ph.D student at the University of Maryland (UMD) in the Department of Computer Science and am being advised by Dr. Amanda Lazar of The Health, Aging, and Technology Lab at UMD. My interests lie at the intersection of HCI, CSCW, Extended Reality (XR), and Accessibility. Specifically, as part of my research, I design, build, and study XR systems for remote collaboration and remote expert guidance in hobby settings (e.g. gardening) following a user-centered mixed-methods approach. You can find the related, Python, Web, Unity, Swift etc. code for research-related and other projects on my github repo. Some of the repos are private, so feel free to email me (hmaddali at umd dot edu) if interested in a particular project. You can also find links to related publications at the ACM SIGCHI and CSCW conferences on my CV.
